Chemical.content:
Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Hepatic tissue was assayed for lipid peroxidation products and oxidized and reduced glutathione .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| lipid peroxidation products |
| oxidized glutathione |
| reduced glutathione |

Explanation:

1. "lipid peroxidation products" - These are chemicals that form when lipids (fats) in the body react with oxygen, often as a result of oxidative stress.
2. "oxidized glutathione" - This is a chemical formed when glutathione, an antioxidant in the body, is oxidized (i.e., loses an electron) during its role in protecting cells from damage.
3. "reduced glutathione" - This is the form of glutathione that can donate an electron to neutralize oxidants and is therefore an important antioxidant in the body.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| lipid peroxidation products |
| oxidized glutathione |
| reduced glutathione |

Explanation:

The original paragraph contains three chemical entities:

1. "lipid peroxidation products" - These are chemicals that form when lipids (fats) in the body react with oxygen, often as a result of oxidative stress.
2. "oxidized glutathione" - This is a chemical formed when glutathione, an antioxidant in the body, is oxidized (i.e., loses an electron) during its role in protecting cells from damage.
3. "reduced glutathione" - This is the form of glutathione that can donate an electron to neutralize oxidants and is therefore an important antioxidant in the body.

There are no entities in the paragraph that do not clearly refer to "Chemical".
